00039 /**
00040 * @file thread.h
00041 * @date 2008/05/04 16:21
00042 * @author Lutz Dittrich, Sergio Montenegro
00043 *
00044 * Copyright 2008 DLR
00045 *
00046 * A Thread is an active schedulable object with own context and stack
00047 *
00048 * @brief %A %thread (thread)
00049 */
00050 
00051 #ifndef __THREAD_H__
00052 #define __THREAD_H__
00053 
00054 #include "listelement.h" // required when compilng with posix
00055 #include "timemodel.h"
00056 #include "params.h"
00057 
00058 
00059 #ifndef NO_RODOS_NAMESPACE
00060 namespace RODOS {
00061 #endif
00062 
00063 extern "C" {
00064   void schedulerWrapper(long* ctx);
00065 }
00066 
00067 
00068 /**
00069 * @class Thread
00070 * @brief %Thread provides stack and context management
00071 */
00072 class Thread : public ListElement {
00073   friend void schedulerWrapper(long* ctx);
00074   friend void threadStartupWrapper(Thread*);
00075   friend void initSystem();
00076   friend void startIdleThread();
00077   friend class Scheduler;
00078   friend class ThreadChecker; // not in RODOS, maybe created by users
00079 
00080 private:
00081   static List threadList; ///< List of all threads
00082   long stackSize;         ///< size of the thread's stack in bytes
00083   long* stack;            ///< pointer to the thread's stack (beginn high growing low)
00084   char* stackBegin;       ///< stack growns down, this is the lower limit
00085   volatile long* context; ///< pointer to stored context
00086 
00087   // Activation control
00088   /**  priority of thread, higher values are serverd first  */
00089   volatile long priority;
00090 
00091   /** It will be activated only after this time */
00092   volatile TTime suspendedUntil;
00093 
00094   /** if waiting for reactivation from someone, eg semaphore */
00095   void* waitingFor;
00096 
00097   TTime nextBeat;  ///<  the next time to awake (used in wait)
00098   TTime period;    ///<  To repeate every period localTime units
00099 
00100   void create(); ///< called in main() after all constuctors, to create/init thread
00101 
00102   // Used only by the Scheduler and ThreadManager (friends)
00103   volatile unsigned long long lastActivation; ///< used by scheduling algorithm
00104   void activate(); ///< continue the execution of the thread
00105 
00106   static void initializeThreads(); ///< call the init method of all threads
00107   static Thread* currentThread; ///< pointer to currently running thread
00108 
00109 public:
00110 
00111   /**
00112    * Initialization of the thread. A user should use a meaningful name for the thread.
00113    *
00114    * @param name Name of the thread.
00115    * @param priority The priority for the thread. Only the thread with the highest value from
00116    *        several runnable threads at a time get computing resources.
00117    * @param stackSize The size of the stack memory for the thread. Choice a matching value for
00118    *        the task of the thread.
00119    *
00120    * @see DEFAULT_THREAD_PRIORITY
00121    * @see DEFAULT_STACKSIZE
00122    */
00123   Thread(const char* name = "AnonymThread",
00124          const long priority = DEFAULT_THREAD_PRIORITY,
00125          const long stackSize = DEFAULT_STACKSIZE);
00126 
00127   /// Destructor
00128   virtual ~Thread();
00129 
00130   /**
00131    * Entry point for user code. The thread activities shall implement by overloading this method.
00132    */
00133   virtual void run() = 0;
00134 
00135   /**
00136    * The method is called after all constructors are executed and before the threads are activated
00137    * by a call to the method run.
00138    *
00139    * It should be overloaded in case the thread has to call other objects for the initialization,
00140    * hence after all instances are present and before any run method is invoked.
00141    *
00142    * @see run
00143    */
00144   virtual void init() {}
00145 
00146   /**
00147    * Get priority of thread.
00148    *
00149    * @return The priority of the thread.
00150    */
00151   long getPriority() const;
00152 
00153   /**
00154    * Set priority of thread
00155    *
00156    * @param[in] prio The new priority of the thread.
00157    */
00158   void setPriority(const long prio);
00159 
00160   static void startAllThreads(); ///< if required (only on gast OSs) called by scheduler
00161 
00162   /**  
00163    * Suspend the thread until a given time or a wake up by a call to the method resume.
00164    * By the optional pointer to a signaler the thread could be woken up. A signal is for
00165    * example an object of type inherited from class Event.
00166    *
00167    * @param[in] reactivationTime Optional time to wake up. Default value is end of time.
00168    * @param[in] signaler Pointer to signaler, which can resume the thread.
00169    *
00170    * @return True if the thread is resumed, false if the reactivation time is reached.
00171    *
00172    * @see resume
00173    * @see Event
00174    */
00175   static bool suspendCallerUntil(const TTime reactivationTime = END_OF_TIME, void* signaler = 0);
00176 
00177   /**
00178    * Suspend a thread until the next computing period of the thread start. The computing periods are
00179    * computed from a start and a periodical time set with the method setPeriodicBeat. The thread is
00180    * suspend for ever if setPeriodicBeat isn't called before a call to this method.
00181    *
00182    * A call to method resume by another thread or an subscribed event or topic can wake up the thread
00183    * before the next computing period starts. In this cases the reason shall checked by the thread after
00184    * wake up.
00185    *
00186    * @see setPeriodicBeat
00187    * @see resume
00188    * @see Subscriber
00189    */
00190   void suspendUntilNextBeat();
00191 
00192   /**
00193    * Defines the start of computing periods for the method suspendUntilNextBeat.
00194    *
00195    * @param begin Time for first the start time of the first computing period.
00196    * @param period Period between the start time of computing periods.
00197    *
00198    * @see suspendUntilNextBeat
00199    */
00200   void setPeriodicBeat(const TTime begin, const TTime period);
00201 
00202   /**
00203    * Resume the thread. The tread get after the call to the method computing resources if no
00204    * other thread with a higher priority occupy the resources. It end calls to the methods
00205    * suspendCallerUntil and suspendUntilNextBeat.
00206    *
00207    * @see suspendCallerUntil
00208    * @see suspendUntilNextBeat
00209    * @see Semaphore
00210    */
00211   void resume();
00212 
00213    /**
00214     * like resume, but if the resumed thread has a higher piroirty than the runing one
00215     * then a task switch will take place at oncce.
00216     *
00217     * WARNING: NEVER call it from an interrupt server
00218     */
00219 
00220     void resumeAndYield() { resume() ; yield(); }
00221 
00222   /**
00223    * Cause the currently running thread to pause and perform a reschedule.
00224    */
00225   static void yield();
00226 
00227   /**
00228    * Get a pointer to the currently running thread. The method can used to identify the calling thread in
00229    * classes with no inheritance to the class Thread.
00230    *
00231    * @return Pointer to the currently running thread.
00232    */
00233   static Thread* getCurrentThread();
00234 
00235   /**
00236    * Search over all threads and select the one with the highest priority which is ready to run
00237    *
00238    * @return The pointer to the highest priorized runnable thread.
00239    *
00240    * @see resume
00241    */
00242   static Thread* findNextToRun(TTime timeNow);
00243 
00244   /**
00245    * Search over all threads and select the one with the highest priority which is not ready to run
00246    * and waiting for the given signaler.
00247    *
00248    * @param signaler Pointer to the signaler where the thread has to wait on.
00249    *
00250    * @return Pointer to the highest priorized thread waiting on the signaler.
00251    */
00252   static Thread* findNextWaitingFor(void* signaler);
00253 
00254   /**
00255    * Get the schedule counter.
00256    *
00257    * @return The current schedule counter. The counter is increased for each schedule operation.
00258    */
00259   static unsigned long long getScheduleCounter();
00260 
00261   /**
00262    * Sets the priority of the currently running thread. Use it carefully.
00263    *
00264    * @param newPrio Priority to set to the currently running thread.
00265    *
00266    * @return The previous priority of the currently running thread.
00267    *
00268    * @see setPriority
00269    */
00270   static long setPrioCurrentRunner(long newPrio); 
00271 
00272 };
00273 
00274 /******************************************************
00275  * Shortcuts for often used constructs
00276  *******************************************************/
00277 
00278 /**
00279  * a pointer to the currently running thread
00280  **/
00281 
00282 #define RUNNER() Thread::getCurrentThread()
00283 
00284 
00285 /**
00286  * TIME_LOOP is a shortcut for setting and using time beats
00287  * TIME_LOOP(begin,period) both in localTime units
00288  * using setPeriodicBeat(...) and waitUntilNexBeat()
00289  */
00290 
00291 #define TIME_LOOP(_begin, _period) for(setPeriodicBeat(_begin, _period);suspendUntilNextBeat(), true; )
00292 
00293 
00294 /**
00295  * AT is a shortcut to wait until a time point.
00296  * use AT(time); ....
00297  * to suspend for always use
00298  * AT(END_OF_TIME);
00299  */
00300 
00301 #define AT(_time) { Thread::suspendCallerUntil(_time); }
00302 
00303 
00304 
00305 /**
00306  * usualy you can create short atomar sections using the macro PRIOTIRY_CEILING
00307  * which is the standard, recomended procedure.
00308  * 
00309  * But some applications demand enableing and disabling the scheduling process. 
00310  * for thos aplications we use globalAtomarLock and globalAromarUnlock
00311  *
00312  * WARNING!!!:   Deprecated
00313  *   avoid it! (no implementation on posix derivates)
00314  *   In multicore processors it does not help!
00315  */
00316 
00317 extern void globalAtomarLock();
00318 extern void globalAtomarUnlock();
00319 
00320 
00321 #ifndef NO_RODOS_NAMESPACE
00322 }
00323 #endif
00324 
00325 #endif /* __THREAD_H__ */
